posts.post_content:
At his worst, he's the important half of a [Momentous Fall](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Momentous Fall) for an extra {G} that doesn't lose you the creature. Even the threat of strong card draw in mono green, if you don't suicide him, can be a strong enough distraction to warrant removal or swinging, getting you a turn to attack with your presumed fatties.  
  
4.5/5

posts.post_content:
I have this Garruk in my [Experiment Kraj](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Experiment Kraj) EDH, which is built to draw 30+ cards a turn after it gets rolling, then drawing victory from [Laboratory Maniac](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Laboratory Maniac).  
  
I find it ironic that this Garruk out draws the [Memory Adept](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Memory Adept) I have in the deck, the [Tezzeret the Seeker](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Tezzeret the Seeker) out mana ramps the only green Planeswalker. (He uses his -X to tutor the artifact lands, [Mox Opal](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Mox Opal), and [Sol Ring](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Sol Ring). He also uses his +1 to untap them when he's all done with that.)

Posted By: knighti8 (11/3/2012 4:45:35 AM)

posts.post_content:
M12's theme was 'Gather Your Allies'. The Planeswalkers' stories have established that nearly all the characters are well acquainted as either friends or friends of friends. Ajani is the only 'good guy' that has had close personal dealings with Bolas. (on the scale of white and black, I'm calling Jace gray. He don't count.) This Ajani is a 'Caller' of his Pride. For a while, I thought that Karn might be the next leader/driving force behind any 'New Coalition'. Some people think it's gonna be Jace, because of Return to Ravnica. Here's my view:  
  
Comparing the Planeswalkers to the Avengers, Jace is Nick Fury or Iron Man: well-connected, sends out the invites, a pretty badass douchebag. Or a pretty douchebag \*\*\*. One or the other. :P  
And he's VERY Rich, certainly much richer for his age than anyone has a right to be. Sorin and Bolas are richer...but they weren't trying too hard and they're older than dirt, so it doesn't count as much.  
  
Ajani has GOT to be the Captain America though- th... [(see all)](javascript:void(0);)

Posted By: TowerDefender (5/19/2013 9:59:42 AM)
Rating:

posts.post_content: Compared to [Garruk Wildspeaker](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Garruk Wildspeaker), a sort of land ramp/giant growth planeswalker and [Garruk Relentless](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Garruk Relentless), of which I have no idea where Wizards was going with that, Garruk Primal Hunter is the creature generating planeswalker. And not only that, he gives you creatures with sizable bodies that will help fuel Naya, Gruul, and Selesnya decks. He also draws cards, which is huge for a green planeswalkers. As for complaints, the only one I have was that he was 3GG as opposed to 2GGG. I think that would've made him slightly easier to play without being broken. But having used him, he's one of my favorite planeswalker's of all time.
posts.html:
Compared to Garruk Wildspeaker, a sort of land ramp/giant growth planeswalker and Garruk Relentless, of which I have no idea where Wizards was going with that, Garruk Primal Hunter is the creature generating planeswalker. And not only that, he gives you creatures with sizable bodies that will help fuel Naya, Gruul, and Selesnya decks. He also draws cards, which is huge for a green planeswalkers. As for complaints, the only one I have was that he was 3GG as opposed to 2GGG. I think that would've made him slightly easier to play without being broken. But having used him, he's one of my favorite planeswalker's of all time.
